model

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.Board
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    DynamicBoard, StaticBoard

    public abstract class Board
extends java.lang.Object
    The Board class is the abstract superclass for the concrete classes StaticBoard and DynamicBoard. The Board classes handles the playing board of the game, containing the current generations cells and their neighbours. Manipulation of the current cell grid is done through these classes. The Board class is also responsible for adding any loaded patterns to the current cell grid.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Board

        public Board()

    • Method Detail

      • countNeighbours

        public byte[][] countNeighbours()
        A method that creates a 2D-array the size of the cell grid for counting neighbours. Iterates through the entire current cell grid and calls setNeighbours if the cell is active for it to add 1 to each surrounding cell. Returns the 2D-array with the neighbour count for each cell.
        Returns:
        neighbours - 2D-array with neighbours counted for each cell.
        See Also:
        getCellState(int, int), setNeighbours(byte[][], int, int)

      • countNeighboursConcurrent

        public byte[][] countNeighboursConcurrent(byte[][] neighbours,
                                          int curIndex,
                                          int rowsPerWorker)
        A method that iterates through and counts neighbours for the current cell grid concurrently. The neighbours 2D-byte array is split up according to how many active threads there are, and each thread iterates through its portion of the array. Calls setNeighbours if the cell is active for it to add 1 to each surrounding cell. Returns the 2D-array with the neighbour count for each cell.
        Parameters:
        neighbours - 2D-byte array where new neighbours are set.
        curIndex - The current thread's index.
        rowsPerWorker - The number of rows each thread should consider.
        Returns:
        neighbours - 2D-array with neighbours counted for each cell.
        See Also:
        getCellState(int, int), setNeighbours(byte[][], int, int)

      • resetBoard

        public void resetBoard()
        A method for making every cell in the cell grid inactive. Iterates through the grid and sets every cell to 0, sets the number of live cells to 0, as well as discarding any pattern that has been loaded without being finalized.
        See Also:
        cellsAlive, setCellState(int, int, byte), discardPattern()

      • setBoard

        public void setBoard(byte[][] newGrid)
        A method for setting the cell grid from an existing 2D-array. Iterates through newGrid and sets the cells of the corresponding places in the cell grid to be equal to those of newGrid.
        Parameters:
        newGrid - The grid to be placed in the current cell grid.
        See Also:
        setCellState(int, int, byte)

      • setBoardConcurrent

        public void setBoardConcurrent(byte[][] newGrid,
                               int curIndex,
                               int rowsPerWorker)
        A method for setting the cell grid from an existing 2D-array concurrently. The new grid is split into as many parts as there are threads, and each thread iterates through it's portion of the newGrid and sets the cells of the corresponding (x,y)-coordinates in the cell grid to be equal to those of newGrid.
        Parameters:
        newGrid - The grid to be placed in the current cell grid.
        curIndex - The current thread's index.
        rowsPerWorker - The number of rows each thread should operate on.
        See Also:
        setCellState(int, int, byte)

      • countCellsAlive

        public int countCellsAlive()
        A method for counting the current live cells. Iterates through the cell grid and adds 1 to the counter for every active cell, before returning the counter.
        Returns:
        count - The final count of active cells.
        See Also:
        getCellState(int, int)

      • getSumXYCoordinates

        public int getSumXYCoordinates()
        A method that returns the sum of all active cells x and y coordinates. Iterates through the cell grid and adds the x and y value to the sum for each active cell.
        Returns:
        xySum - The sum of all active cells x and y coordinates.
        See Also:
        getCellState(int, int)

      • getBoundingBox

        public int[] getBoundingBox()
        A method that returns the bounding box of the current cell grid. The bounding box is the smallest area around the active cells of the cell grid, and is represented by 4 values, the minimum and maximum of rows and columns. Returns an int array.
        Returns:
        boundingBox - An int array containing the minimum and maximum values for rows and columns.
        See Also:
        getCellState(int, int)

      • trim

        public byte[][] trim()
        A method that returns the smallest grid containing all active cells from the current cell grid. It calls #getBoundingBox() and creates a new 2D-array with the number of rows and columns from that. Then it iterates through the current cell grid with the values of the bounding box and sets each cell in the new 2D-array to be the same as the cell grid in that area.
        Returns:
        trimmedBoard - The smallest possible 2D-array containing all active cells from the current cell grid.
        See Also:
        getCellState(int, int), getBoundingBox()

      • setBoardFromRLE

        public void setBoardFromRLE(byte[][] importedBoard)
        A method that sets loadedPattern and loadedPatternBoundingBox from a loaded pattern. The bounding box of the loaded pattern is initially set so that the pattern will be placed in the middle of the current cell grid.
        Parameters:
        importedBoard - The grid that has been loaded, and is to be set.
        See Also:
        loadedPattern, loadedPatternBoundingBox, getBoundingBox(byte[][])

      • movePattern

        public void movePattern(java.lang.String direction)
        A method for moving a loaded pattern around in the cell grid. This allows the user to place the pattern where wanted instead of locking it to the initial position. If the board is an instance of DynamicBoard, the cell grid will expand when the pattern reaches the edges of the cell grid. If the board is an instance of StaticBoard and the pattern reaches the edge, it will do nothing.
        Parameters:
        direction - The direction the pattern should be moved.
        See Also:
        loadedPattern, loadedPatternBoundingBox, DynamicBoard.expandHeightUp(int), DynamicBoard.expandHeightDown(int), DynamicBoard.expandWidthRight(int), DynamicBoard.expandWidthLeft(int), DynamicBoard.setHasExpandedLeftTrue(), DynamicBoard.setHasExpandedUpTrue()

      • rotate

        public void rotate(boolean clockwise)
        Method for rotating the loaded pattern within the cell grid. Takes a parameter which indicates if it should be rotated clockwise or counter clockwise, in which the order of operations is different.
        Parameters:
        clockwise - A boolean describing whether of not the pattern should be rotated clockwise.
        See Also:
        loadedPattern, loadedPatternBoundingBox, transposePattern(byte[][]), reverseRows(byte[][]), setNewBoundingBox()

      • finalizeBoard

        public void finalizeBoard()
        Method that places the loaded pattern permanently into the current cell grid, and sets loadedPattern and loadedPatternBoundingBox to null and does a new count of active cells.
        See Also:
        loadedPattern, loadedPatternBoundingBox, cellsAlive, setCellState(int, int, byte)

      • discardPattern

        public void discardPattern()
        Method for discarding a loaded pattern. Sets loadedPattern and its bounding box to null.
        See Also:
        loadedPattern, loadedPatternBoundingBox

      • getLoadedPatternBoundingBox

        public int[] getLoadedPatternBoundingBox()
        Method that returns the bounding box of the current loaded pattern.
        Returns:
        loadedPatternBoundingBox - The current bounding box for the loaded pattern.
        See Also:
        loadedPatternBoundingBox

      • getLoadedPattern

        public byte[][] getLoadedPattern()
        Method that returns the current loaded pattern.
        Returns:
        loadedPattern - The current loaded pattern.
        See Also:
        loadedPattern

      • getCellsAlive

        public int getCellsAlive()
        Method that returns the current cellsAlive count.
        Returns:
        cellsAlive - The number of currently active cells.
        See Also:
        cellsAlive

      • resetCellsAlive

        public void resetCellsAlive()
        Method to set the counter of active cells to zero.
        See Also:
        cellsAlive

      • increaseCellsAlive

        public void increaseCellsAlive()
        Method that increases cellsAlive by 1. Synchronized to avoid a race condition.
        See Also:
        cellsAlive

      • decreaseCellsAlive

        public void decreaseCellsAlive()
        Method that decreases cellsAlive by 1. Synchronized to avoid a race condition.
        See Also:
        cellsAlive

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Method that returns a string representation of the current cell grid, placing each cell in a long string of 1s and 0s. Overrides Objects toString method.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        str.toString - The string representation of the current cellGrid.
        See Also:
        getCellState(int, int), Object.toString()

      • getWidth

        public abstract int getWidth()
        Abstract method for returning an integer representing the width of the current cellGrid. Needs to be overridden in a concrete subclass.
        Returns:
        The width of the playing board.

      • getHeight

        public abstract int getHeight()
        Abstract method for returning an integer representing the height of the current cellGrid. Needs to be overridden in a concrete subclass.
        Returns:
        The height of the playing board.

      • getCellState

        public abstract byte getCellState(int x,
                                  int y)
        Abstract method for returning a byte value representing the state of a certain cell with coordinates (x,y). Needs to be overridden in a concrete subclass.
        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate.
        y - The y coordinate.
        Returns:
        byte - A byte value representing the state of the requested cell.

      • setCellState

        public abstract void setCellState(int x,
                                  int y,
                                  byte state)
        Abstract method for setting the state of a cell with coordinates (x,y). Needs to be overridden in a concrete subclass.
        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate.
        y - The y coordinate.
        state - The state the cell should be set to.

      • clone

        public abstract java.lang.Object clone()
        Abstract method for doing a deep copy of the current Board. Needs to be overridden in a concrete subclass.
        Overrides:
        clone in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        Board - The clone of the board.
